J*MfCABINET.SUBMARINE MINES AND COASTAL MOTOR BOATS FOR SOVIET RUSSIA.Note by the Secretary.The First Lord of the Admiralty has communi-cated for the information of the Cabinet the following Minute by the Director of Naval Intelligence, in regard to the present position of the order for Submarine Mines and Coastal Motor Boats for Soviet Russia, which was sanctioned by the Cabinet on November 21, 192b (Cabinet 52 (28) Conclusion 6).(Signed) M.P.A. HANK EX",Secretary, Cabinet.Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1, January 26, 1929 ....ADMIRALTY.1st. Lord.The Managing Director of Messrs Vickersinforms me that negotiations are still inprogress in regard to this order,, but that sofar nothing has eventuated. He will keep meinformed of the trend of events.. If the orderdoes come, the CM.B's will be built by MessrsThornycroft, who are specialists in this line.(Sd.) BARRY DOMVILE, D .N.I. S4th January, 1929.,
